content: I'm really interested in the non-linear storytelling aspect of both shows. I love how "Stranger Things" also explores complex characters and plot twists. Speaking of which, I binge-watched the entire third season within a week, and I was hooked on the Mind Flayer's backstory and Eleven's character development. Do you think I'll find similar character-driven storytelling in "The Haunting of Hill House" and "The OA"?
